au.com.codeka.carrot.resource

Class FileResourceLocater

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.com.codeka.carrot.resource.FileResourceLocater
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ResourceLocater

    public class FileResourceLocater
extends java.lang.Object
implements ResourceLocater
    An implementation of ResourceLocater that loads files from the file system.

    • Constructor Summary

      FileResourceLocater(Configuration config, java.lang.String basePath)
      Constructs a new FileResourceLocater using the given Configuration and base path to search for resources in.

    • Method Detail

      • findResource

        public ResourceName findResource(@Nullable
                                 ResourceName parent,
                                 java.lang.String name)
                          throws CarrotException
        Description copied from interface: ResourceLocater
        Searches for a resource with the given name, returns the full path to it.

        This will search for the resource in the given path first, if not found there will search a locator-specific search path for the resource before giving up.

        Specified by:
        findResource in interface ResourceLocater
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent to look for the resource in. If not found here, we will also do a search for a non-relative name. May be null to search only in the search path.
        name - The name of the resource to search file.
        Returns:
        A ResourceName representing the resolved name of the resource.
        Throws:
        CarrotException - If the resource cannot be found.

      • findResource

        Description copied from interface: ResourceLocater

      • getModifiedTime

        public long getModifiedTime(ResourceName resourceName)
                     throws CarrotException
        Description copied from interface: ResourceLocater
        Gets a value which indicates when the resource was modified. This could be a timestamp, but it could also be a hash, the actual value doesn't matter as long as it's different when the resource is modified.

        The value is used to determine whether we need to flush our caches, and this function will be called for every request to render a template, so calling this needs to be quick.

        Zero indicates this ResourceLocater doesn't support modification detection, and resources will be cached indefinitely.

        Specified by:
        getModifiedTime in interface ResourceLocater
        Parameters:
        resourceName - The ResourceName of the resource.
        Returns:
        A value indicating the 'last modified time' (or a hash) of the resource.
        Throws:
        CarrotException - If the resource cannot be found.

      • getReader

        public java.io.Reader getReader(ResourceName resourceName)
                         throws CarrotException
        Description copied from interface: ResourceLocater
        Gets a Reader to read the contents of the given resource.
        Specified by:
        getReader in interface ResourceLocater
        Parameters:
        resourceName - The ResourceName of the resource.
        Returns:
        A Reader for reading the contents of the resource.
        Throws:
        CarrotException - If the resource cannot be found.
